Name: viral labyrinthitis
Definition: A labyrinthitis which involves viral infection of the inner ear through the upper airway or the blood stream. The symptoms may include hearing loss and ringing in the ears. If the virus reaches the vestibular system

Name: purulent labyrinthitis
Definition: A labyrinthitis which is a bacterial infectious disease of the inner ear

Name: obsolete intrapelvic lymph node mast cell malignancy
Definition: A labyrinthitis which is a bacterial infectious disease of the inner ear
Synonym: Mast cell malignancy of intrapelvic lymph nodes (disorder)

Name: focal labyrinthitis
Definition: A labyrinthitis which is an infectious inflammatory disease of a circumscribed area of either the vestibular or the cochlear portion of the labyrinth

Name: serous labyrinthitis
Definition: A labyrinthitits in which bacterial toxins invade the inner ear. It is the most common complication of acute or chronic middle ear infections.
